paragraphs.text: %md ## Anomaly Detection to Detect Unusual or Rare Occurrences Oracle Machine Learning supports anomaly detection to identify rare or unusual records (customers, transactions, etc.) in the data using the semi-supervised learning algorithm One-Class Support Vector Machine. In this notebook, you will build a 1Class-SVM model and then use it to flag unusual or suspicious records. The data used in this example is from the SH schema. The entire machine learning methodology runs inside Oracle Autonomous Database (ADB). Copyright (c) 2023 Oracle Corporation ###### The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0 ---

msg.data:
Anomaly Detection to Detect Unusual or Rare Occurrences

Oracle Machine Learning supports anomaly detection to identify rare or unusual records (customers, transactions, etc.) in the data using the semi-supervised learning algorithm One-Class Support Vector Machine. In this notebook, you will build a 1Class-SVM model and then use it to flag unusual or suspicious records. The data used in this example is from the SH schema. The entire machine learning methodology runs inside Oracle Autonomous Database (ADB).

Copyright (c) 2023 Oracle Corporation

The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0

paragraphs.title: Create view DEMOGRAPHICS_V with columns of interest
paragraphs.text:
%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW DEMOGRAPHICS_V AS
  SELECT CUST_ID, YRS_RESIDENCE, EDUCATION, AFFINITY_CARD, 
         HOUSEHOLD_SIZE, OCCUPATION, BOOKKEEPING_APPLICATION, 
         BULK_PACK_DISKETTES, FLAT_PANEL_MONITOR, HOME_THEATER_PACKAGE,
         OS_DOC_SET_KANJI, PRINTER_SUPPLIES, Y_BOX_GAMES
  FROM SH.SUPPLEMENTARY_DEMOGRAPHICS;

paragraphs.title: Display DEMOGRAPHICS_V data
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT * 
FROM DEMOGRAPHICS_V
FETCH FIRST 20 ROWS ONLY;

paragraphs.title: Create view joining CUSTOMERS and DEMOGRAPHICS_V
paragraphs.text:
%script

CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW CUSTOMERS360_V AS
   SELECT a.CUST_ID, a.CUST_GENDER, a.CUST_MARITAL_STATUS, a.CUST_YEAR_OF_BIRTH, 
          a.CUST_INCOME_LEVEL, a.CUST_CREDIT_LIMIT, b.EDUCATION, b.AFFINITY_CARD, 
          b.HOUSEHOLD_SIZE, b.OCCUPATION, b.YRS_RESIDENCE, b.Y_BOX_GAMES
   FROM SH.CUSTOMERS a, DEMOGRAPHICS_V b
   WHERE a.CUST_ID = b.CUST_ID;

paragraphs.title: Display CUSTOMERS360_V
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT * 
FROM CUSTOMERS360_V
FETCH FIRST 20 ROWS ONLY;

paragraphs.title: Build an anomaly detection model using the 1-Class SVM algorithm

msg.data:
PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.


---------------------------

PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Display customers in descending order of anomaly probability
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Hint: In anomaly detection, known amomalies should be removed from the training dataset

SELECT * 
FROM (SELECT CUST_ID, anomalous, round(prob_anomalous,2) prob_anomalous, 
             YRS_RESIDENCE, HOUSEHOLD_SIZE, CUST_GENDER,
             CUST_MARITAL_STATUS, 
             rank() over (ORDER BY prob_anomalous DESC) rnk 
      FROM (SELECT CUST_ID, HOUSEHOLD_SIZE, YRS_RESIDENCE, 
                   CUST_GENDER, CUST_MARITAL_STATUS, 
                   prediction(CUSTOMERS360MODEL using *) anomalous,
                   prediction_probability(CUSTOMERS360MODEL, '0' using *) prob_anomalous
            FROM CUSTOMERS360_V))
ORDER BY prob_anomalous DESC
FETCH FIRST 20 ROWS ONLY;

paragraphs.title: Display the top 5 most anomalous customers
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT * 
FROM (SELECT CUST_ID, round(prob_anomalous,2) prob_anomalous,  
             YRS_RESIDENCE, CUST_MARITAL_STATUS, 
             rank() over (ORDER BY prob_anomalous DESC) rnk 
      FROM (SELECT CUST_ID, HOUSEHOLD_SIZE, YRS_RESIDENCE, CUST_GENDER, CUST_MARITAL_STATUS, 
                   prediction_probability(CUSTOMERS360MODEL, '0' using *) prob_anomalous
            FROM CUSTOMERS360_V))
WHERE rnk <= 5
ORDER BY prob_anomalous DESC;

paragraphs.title: View Prediction Details of top 3 attributes to explain prediction
paragraphs.text:
%sql
-- Select customers with OCCUPATION 'TechSup' and more than 50% probability of being anomalous 

SELECT CUST_ID, 
       RTRIM(TRIM(SUBSTR(OUTPRED."Attribute1",17,100)),'rank="1"/>') FIRST_ATTRIBUTE,
       RTRIM(TRIM(SUBSTR(OUTPRED."Attribute2",17,100)),'rank="2"/>') SECOND_ATTRIBUTE,
       RTRIM(TRIM(SUBSTR(OUTPRED."Attribute3",17,100)),'rank="3"/>') THIRD_ATTRIBUTE
       FROM (SELECT CUST_ID, PREDICTION_DETAILS(CUSTOMERS360MODEL, '0' USING *) PREDICTION_DETAILS FROM CUSTOMERS360_V
           WHERE PREDICTION_PROBABILITY(CUSTOMERS360MODEL, '0' USING *) > 0.50
           AND OCCUPATION = 'TechSup'
           ORDER BY CUST_ID) OUT,
           XMLTABLE('/Details'
                PASSING OUT.PREDICTION_DETAILS
                COLUMNS 
                   "Attribute1" XMLType PATH 'Attribute[1]',
                   "Attribute2" XMLType PATH 'Attribute[2]',
                   "Attribute3" XMLType PATH 'Attribute[3]') OUTPRED
FETCH FIRST 20 ROWS ONLY;
